conclusion: Identify the given information: Temperature at state A: \( T_A = -73^\circ C = 200 \, \text{K} \), Internal energy change from A to C: \( \Delta U = 200 \, \text{J} \), Volume at state A: \( V_A = 1 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \), Volume at state C: \( V_C = 4 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \), Pressure at state A: \( P_A = 3 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \), Pressure at state C: \( P_C = 1 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \)

Use the ideal gas law: The ideal gas law is given by: \( PV = nRT \) where \( P \) is the pressure, \( V \) is the volume, \( n \) is the number of moles, \( R \) is the gas constant, and \( T \) is the temperature in Kelvin.

premise: At state A: \( P_A V_A = nRT_A \)
conclusion: Calculate the number of moles: \( 3 \times 10^5 \times 1 \times 10^{-3} = nR \times 200 \), \( 300 = nR \times 200 \), \( nR = \frac{300}{200} = 1.5 \)

premise: At state C: \( P_C V_C = nRT_C \)
conclusion: Determine the temperature at state C: \( 1 \times 10^5 \times 4 \times 10^{-3} = 1.5 \times T_C \), \( 400 = 1.5 \times T_C \), \( T_C = \frac{400}{1.5} = 266.67 \, \text{K} \)
Convert the temperature to Celsius: \( T_C = 266.67 \, \text{K} - 273 = -6.33^\circ C \)
